title: Oracle's Alteration Should Not Activate Boxes.
body:
Hello, Pink Ward here, long time AP Shaco main living in mid to high diamond for the past couple of seasons. I come here today to talk about AP Shaco and the difficulties the playstyle has faced due to AD Shaco being too strong. AD Shaco is by far the best way to play Shaco. Whether it be Jungle, Full AD Assassin, Duskblade, Yomuus, one shots or Duskblade Trinity Bruiser, it is definitely the best way to play Shaco. This playstyle has very little counterplay, as Shaco's stealth is one of the more infuriating things about playing against the champion. Yet, the champion doesn't have much damage built into his kit. AD Shaco gets most of his damage through the items he snowballs into. And in the longterm of games, Shaco's W is fairly weak and maxed last. It's fairly worthless to AD Shaco players outside of jungle camps or an after thought. This is where my playstyle I've created comes into play. 

As an AP Shaco main, I have always tried my best to think ahead and using my game knowledge I've obtained over years of playing, I'm able to predict what my opponents will do. Setting up boxes to try and get the best outcome out of situations. Yet, Shaco's boxes have one huge weakness. A FREE item that lasts 10 seconds, able to be bought by everyone on a team, Oracle's Alteration (Along with Control Wards effect.) How red trinket works against Shaco's traps are completely different from other traps in the game. Against Jhin, Teemo and Nidalee, when the red trinket effect is hovered over the traps, they become visible, reducing their vision and become attackable. Someone MUST attack them to kill them, or they will go back to being invisible once the Trinket/Control Ward effect wears off. It is different with Shaco's boxes. It activates the boxes and leaves them to die after the 5 seconds of lifespan they have after being activated. Take this clip vs Zed for example. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Xfo6MUG9jQ

In the clip you see Zed pop Oracles Alteration. He's being greedy, so he's running into all the boxes, tanking the damage from them. But any sane person would see the boxes and just walk away. Now take notice of the two boxes at the bottom, they do nothing. They get activated and die after 5 seconds. Those 2 boxes are effectively 30 seconds of the game taken away from Shaco. Red trinket completely reduces this playstyle to irrelevancy. Some great examples of Red trinket if it countered other abilities in the game would be if those two boxes were Teemo shrooms instead, what if they instantly explode when hovered by the red trinket, would that be fair? Or while chasing Singed, if activating red trinket would get rid of his poison trail as you chased him down. It would make these champions completely useless.

Some of you will say that Shaco's "playstyle" is AD Assassin, jump in and one shot. And yes, you are correct, but that's because Riot has nurtured Shaco into that. Every little thing they've done to Shaco has taken away from the box playstyle and pushed him towards an On Hit Assassin. They added on hit damage to backstab, on hit damage to Deceive (Shaco's Q), Changed E from Magic damage to Physical damage. This is the toxic playstyle that everyone hates to play against. Why would you want to argue for more players to play this playstyle? AP Shaco was a unique and intricate way to play Shaco because your playstyle would evolve depending on what your opponent would do or how they would play. And it was always easily counterable, don't chase shaco into his boxes, then he won't have the damage to kill you. But now, with anyone able to /purchase/ a free item, it just devolves the playstyle into nothing.

Riot's explanation of why this is how Red trinkets works is due to melees needing counterplay to Shaco boxes. Yet, there are countless melees in the game that can one shot boxes at level 9, usually the time an enemy will be buying a red trinket. Red trinket makes the Shaco matchup a complete joke because now boxes lose their fear effect and can be one shot. Any meta champion makes a joke out of Shaco boxes once scanned. Here are a couple of examples, Renekton One shots boxes with furried Q, Irelia can Q hops to any visible boxes once her Q is lvl 5, killing each box in one shot. Jax's counterstrike dodges box autos, then stuns them. Aatrox out ranges and one shot's boxes before level 9 due to mass amounts of aoe. Viktor is a ranged champion, so boxes don't effect him much anyway. My point is there are many ways to counter Shaco boxes that don't just make them a worthless ability. Without red trinket, I have a chance to fight back against other champions. The box fear is a main factor of the AP Shaco playstyle, but without it, you're forced to play AP Shaco as an inferior AP on hit Assassin.  

My suggestion would to make red trinket have the same effect on boxes that pink wards used to have on them. Give vision of the boxes for Ranged champions to clear, or for lower IQ players to run into. Adding to this, in lane, minions aggro boxes as if they were minions to attack. So if they are revealed, minions will walk into them and activate the boxes. Many of you will probably complain, not wanting a "buff" to AD shaco, but this wouldn't be a buff to AD Shaco. Very few, if any, AD Shaco players will gain any benefit from a change to red trinket. Wrapping this up, this playstyle is supposed to counter stupidity and greediness. Red trinket is just a cheat sheet for the IQ test that are Shaco boxes. 

Thank you for your time reading. Much love.

replies.body:
The boxes should be silenced and revealed (so that melees can destroy them) for the duration of the oracle, and then go back to their "armed" hidden state imo.

If I use an oracle, and go up to destroy the box, I shouldn't be feared and shot to death, otherwise the boxes have more agency than Teemo's ultimate ability. I know that comparing two abilities in different kits is often a bad idea, but they're both traps that essentially do magic dot and cc. 

Also when there are two ways of playing a champion, one will naturally be better than the other, and the meta build of that champion will polarise to the strongest build. 

I would like Lich bane supports to be more viable as it would widen the support champion pool and introduce more skill matchups, but reducing the cost of lich bane (because it's gold efficiency compared to ludens, other sheen items and hextech items, is garbage) has knock on effects to lots of champions including, coincidentally, AP shaco. I think AP Shaco suffers from the Lich Bane balancing problem (if you reduce cost and nerf the champions that have it in their meta build to balance them, you create a reliance on that item, meaning their build path becomes less creative. So you keep the cost high to increase creativity, gutting champions that want to build it) and that's a big problem for him imo, as the item should cost 2900 tops. It delays AP shaco's item powerspike by a few key mid game minutes.

I'd also like armour stacking malphite support to be viable, but he can't trade in lane without a lot of damage on his Q so you auto lose vs any enemy bot laners with brains, so he's forced to go AP. I could ask for more base Q damage and less scaling to fix this, but people see "more base damage ree" and won't realise that it encourages tankier builds. 

Point is, riot doesn't seem to care too much about how to make champions fun and rewarding to play. They seem to like to make champions awful to play against and unrewarding to play. When I kill someone with one rotation of abilities as AP Malphite support, I feel kinda bad, if anything.

They most definitely should not be "silenced".. your comparison to Teemo falls flat as well. Teemo's shrooms will still go off if you walk over them, red trinket changes nothing about how they work other than the fact that you can now see them. Seeing Shaco's box gives you the option to not walk into it, that's all the counterplay you should be granted from using a trinket against a core ability of a champion. Completely disabling Shaco's boxes because you activated a free item is the furthest thing from a good idea (in fact I think they already did that and they took it away because it was stupid).
But Shaco's boxes should and already do have more agency than Teemo's ultimate, they're cc and damage. Teemo's R is a short cd for a mushroom that slows and does damage.
What about armor scaling on q too? Lol.
i feel like boxes should work like teemo shrooms you can see them but they still activate if you run into them just like you suggested
Issue is unlike Teemo shrooms you wouldn't be able to disable them if you're melee

> [{quoted}](name=Eedat,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A99Ffqh3,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-12-22T15:12:15.450+0000)
>
> Issue is unlike Teemo shrooms you wouldn't be able to disable them if you're melee

And why is that?

If they cared they could code the box a bigger hitbox while disabled to allow melee destruction.

Well if they did that I wouldn't mind. But as a purely melee champion player I hate boxes. Melee champs that don't have spammable ranged spells that oneshot them are effectively zoned out of that area.

Also, Oracle's Lens is a 90-60 second cooldown and replaces ward trinket. That's already a huge trade-off to pay to combat a champion's kit.

Oh no, the trap zones you out of an area?!?! 

That's the whole point of them. Why should you get to ignore an entire ability just because you have a trinket? Seeing them is plenty.

Until that "area" is literally your lane.

The boxes being "killed" by Oracles without being attacked is pretty shitty, I can agree with that. But your trinket being negated by one of the things it's literally designed to counter is also shitty.

So there's two options here I can accept: 1) Stays as is. 2) Boxes don't activate under Oracles under any circumstance. They don't kill themselves but they also don't pop up and fear someone clearing them with Oracles.

Edit: Whoops forgot the third: 3) Boxes activate under Oracles but have increased hit range or reduced fear range while under the effect so melee champs can hit em without activating them.

It's impossible to block an entire lane with traps.. not only can they not stack within a certain area, but minions will easily clear them in most places.

Both of those options suck tbh, a free item with no cost to activate and a relatively low cd shouldn't hold that much power over a whole champion.
If they shifted that power over to a control ward then that might be acceptable, but a free trinket that follows you around... really?

A "free" trinket that replaces the one that makes your lane way safer? A free trinket with a 90-60 second cooldown?

Teemo's shrooms are still a threat even with Oracles and that's an ultimate ability with a 30 second cooldown too.

And ofcourse not the entire lane. Minions exist. But hell, look at the clip. Look at that massive safety net of boxes granted by being ahead in the lane. And when Shaco isn't ahead those boxes are on the sides where minions can't roam to, locking you behind your minions.

So tell me, if Oracles did absolutely nothing to boxes, what's the counterplay? Spend 225 gold on 3 control wards every time you back (and therefore lose vision control from an actual well placed CW)? Never venture outside your minion wave and completely give up lane control? There has to be counterplay and Riot specifically designed Oracles (previously the elixir) to be that counterplay.

You ever play against an ap Shaco in lane? The counterplay is that he literally can't do anything to you unless you walk into the boxes repeatedly. Just outfarm him and win the game?   
  
The Teemo point falls flat again because using oracles doesn't do a single thing to them besides reveal them. They will still slow you and damage you if you just decide to chimp through them. Shaco's boxes cease their primary function the second they hit with a sweeper. It's not the same thing.

It's not the same though, Shaco's boxes **will** still hit you if you chimp through them, but the second that red light touches them they lose the ability to fear. Teemo's shrooms do not lose their slow when revealed by oracle. I'd even go as far as to say the fear is most of the importance of the box, so losing that alone is huge.

To be honest with you I don't think there needs to be any compensation at all.  Zed would have a really hard time killing an evenly skilled and fed Malphite, so why doesn't oracle reduce Malphite's armor by 75% to make it "fair" for the Zed?
Not all champs should have an easy option against everything. There should be some situations where you need a teammate to do the thing you want to do (in this case, clearing out Shaco boxes).

Or you could just easily outfarm him and kill him literally any time he leaves the safety of his boxes. But hey, might as well take the boxes away too, the guy could use yet another weakness in lane.

Uh, most of these points fall flat, because unlike LITERALLY EVERY OTHER TRAP IN THE GAME (Zyra plants aren't a trap, but they pop Shaco boxes and damage them, while Shaco boxes cannot hurt them at all), Shaco's boxes take FULL damage from all AoE, targeted AND non-targeted abilities. You can't kill Teemo shrooms with an Ezreal Q, or Garen's E, or Ahri's W, or any one of Aatrox's hits. You can do that to Shaco boxes without a sweeper. Once they're revealed, sure. They might do a bit of damage. But they die instantly if you have ANY awareness or AoE abilities. They have no scaling HP or resists. 

Teemo shrooms? Nid Traps? Jhin traps? No matter the AD or AP you have, they take multiple hits. Shaco boxes? Grab a Sheen at level 6 and they're dead. Buy a Stormrazor and they're dead. BEFORE they arm. 

Finally, Shaco boxes have TWO instances of crowd control -- first the fear, then the cripple of 100 MS running away. BOTH of these are canceled by Sweeper, as well as making them far too easy to kill.
What are you supposed to do about them then? You can't attack them without setting them off unlike shrooms
Oracles should reveal boxes but not activate them.

Do you realize, unlike Nidalee, Jhin or Teemo, your traps have ranged attacks with huge damage and AOE fear ? Who cares if you are able to see the traps, when you can not  safely approach them to kill them?
Maybe to handle that it could reduce the range at which they proc?  That way melees can still destroy them, but if they try to just run through them they get feared.
If you reduce it's range that much, anyone can just walk between the boxes and kill the shaco without him being able to stop you.

They literally last a minute. If someone can't stay away from a obviously located box, then they are exactly what AP shaco targets as a player. If someone can avoid trading with shaco and just not be a dumbass then its not a problem.
AND it also has a 16 seconds cooldown, so inbetween that 1 minute (+5% AP), Shaco will have placed 4 more obvious boxes that you need to keep track of.

But like he stated, only AP shaco mains use his boxes like this. No AD shaco player is going to utilize them to their full affect, and end up maxing it last. 

They'll do like 20 damage an auto factoring MR when built AD until like level 15-17, it's completely meaningless when you could instead just insta-gib someone with duskblade.
